+Brooklyn and Bailey Don't underestimate your younger audience! Plenty of 
kids and even toddlers are capable of creating dishes and desserts without 
the use of processed mixes and are able to create dishes with more than 4 
ingredients. I see it all the time! Also, making from-scratch creations is 
a healthier option void of extra, unnecesary chemicals and it makes 
children aware of what they are consuming. I hope that in the future you 
keep in mind what is best for your younger audience's health rather than 
the number of ingredients they will need :).
comments.author: Memoria James (memoriaj)

comments.text:
We wanted to do something easy for our younger fans. Something with 4 
ingredients was our goal.  Very difficult to do from scratch. xoxo -Bailey
comments.author: Brooklyn and Bailey

captions.text: -Hey, guys.
I'm Bailey.
-And I'm Brooklyn.

-And today we're going to
be showing you guys how

to do a super yummy St.
Patrick's Day treat because we

are coming upon
St. Patrick's Day.

-And we just started pre-heating
our oven, so let's get started.

-The best thing
about this recipe

is that there are
only four ingredients

that you need to
make the cookies,

and that's really awesome
because some cookie recipes are

really intricate and need
a lot of ingredients,

but this one is super
simple and easy to do.

Another thing that we
want to remind you guys

about is to wash
your hands before you

start baking because you
don't want to spread germs,

and it's just to help
keep all your food clean.

And obviously we've already
washed our hands or else
we wouldn't be baking.

Our very first ingredient is our
Betty Crocker chocolate fudge
cake.

Obviously, you don't need to
use the brand Betty Crocker,

but just make sure
it's chocolate cake,

because that's
part of the recipe.

-Our second ingredient
is two eggs,

and I'm sure everyone has
eggs, so that's all good.

Our third ingredient is
a half cup vegetable oil.
-Or canola oil.
Whichever works for you.
-Whichever one you want to use.

And our fourth ingredient is
creme de menthe baking chips.

And we use Andes brand, but for
those of you who don't, just
use mint baking chips.
-Use whatever it is you've got.
-That's all good.
-Yeah.

So we'll start by
pouring in our cake mix.
-Dump the whole bag in.
-There we go.
Throw that away.

-And then our second
ingredient, our vegetable oil.
We'll just dump that in like so.
Third ingredient eggs.
-Eggs.
-Throw those away.
-Throw those away.

-After you're done pouring
in all of your ingredients,

we are going to take
our mixer and mix it up,

and it is going to be
a little bit sticky,

but that's usual
for cookie dough.
So let us begin.

-Now that we're done mixing
all of our ingredients together

and cookie dough is all
thick and ready to go,

you'll take your spoon, and
you'll just scoop out a scoop.
I don't know how big.
Just a spoonful.
And you'll push it onto the pan.

-After you put it
onto the pan, you're

going to want to flip it
over so that the grease is

on the bottom side
of the cookie.

And press it down with your
spoon so it doesn't stick.

That way we have
enough flat space
to put the Andes mints on later.

-Now that you have your
cookies all laid out,

we're going to put them in
the oven, which is set at 350.

-And you're going to want to
cook them for 6-8 minutes long.
-Yeah.

Now that our cookies
are finished baking,

we are going to take
our mints and just

sprinkle them on
the top of cookie

so that they'll melt and put
a little bit of a frosting
on the top.
-Like a mint layer.
-Best part.

After the mints are done
melting on top of the cookies,

as you can see, they make a
really, really pretty pattern

of just green and
chocolate mixed together.
Yummy, yummy, yum.
Can't wait to eat these.

But what we like to do
when we're done with them,

is we like to scoop them off
and put them in the fridge

so it will harden the
shell of mint on top.

But of course,
totally up to you.
You don't have to do that.

You can always just
let them air cool.
-Air cool.

-Whatever works
for you, but that's

what we usually do
for these cookies.

-This recipe makes about
one to two dozen cookies,

so it can easily be
shared and enjoyed.

And speaking of enjoyed, we hope
you guys enjoyed this video.

Be sure to like,
favorite, and share.

And we'll see you
guys next week.
-Bye.
-Bye.
-Cheers.
To St. Patty's Day.

title: Learn How to Make Chocolate Mint Cookies | Brooklyn and Bailey
